title: Skilling equipment

properties.name: description
properties.value: Skilling outfits increase the experience gained in a specific skill or provide other skill-boosting benefits when worn. These items can be obtained in a number of ways. When every part of an experience-boosting set is worn, they provide a 2.5% experience boost. This boost does not apply to certain experience rewards, such as quest experience rewards or finishing a round of Wintertodt or a Mahogany Homes contract.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Experience-boosting set

Skilling outfits increase the experience gained in a specific skill or provide other skill-boosting benefits when worn. These items can be obtained in a number of ways. When every part of an experience-boosting set is worn, they provide a 2.5% experience boost. This boost does not apply to certain experience rewards, such as quest experience rewards or finishing a round of Wintertodt or a Mahogany Homes contract.

List of outfits[edit | edit source]

Skill Set Effect(s) Source(s)
Agility Graceful outfit
  • Reduces character weight by 25 kg
  • Increases run energy regeneration rate by 30%
 Purchased with marks of grace from Grace's Graceful Clothing
Construction Carpenter's outfit
  • 2.5% experience boost
 Purchased with a total of 2000 points from the Mahogany Homes Reward Shop
Farming Farmer's outfit
  • 2.5% experience boost
 Purchased with a total of 400 points from the Tithe Farm
Firemaking Pyromancer outfit
  • 2.5% experience boost
 Obtained from opening supply crates after subduing the Wintertodt with at least 500 points
Fishing Angler's outfit
  • 2.5% experience boost
  • Obtained from inspecting the trawler net after a game of Fishing Trawler
  • Purchased from Alry the Angler's Angling Accessories
Spirit angler's outfit
  • 2.5% experience boost
  • Acts as a rope for tethering to totem poles and masts while battling Tempoross
 Purchased with spirit flakes and a corresponding angler's outfit piece from Gita Prymes
Mining Prospector kit
  • 2.5% experience boost
 Purchased with golden nuggets from Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop
Golden prospector kit Obtained by using a star fragment on each piece of the regular prospector kit
Prayer Zealot's robes
  • 5.0% chance to save bones / ensouled heads
 Obtained by looting gold chests within the Shade Catacombs
Runecraft Raiments of the Eye
  • 60% more runes when Runecrafting
 Purchased with a total of 1350 Abyssal pearls from the Guardians of the Rift Temple Supplies shop
Thieving Rogue equipment
  • Chance to receive double loot when pickpocketing[n 1]
 Obtained from looting the safe at the end of the Rogues' Den minigame
Woodcutting Lumberjack outfit
  • 2.5% experience boost
 Obtained from Undead Lumberjacks during the bridge puzzle events in the Temple Trekking minigame
  1. ↑ 20% chance per piece, with the full set guaranteeing double loot

Individual items[edit | edit source]

Individual gear pieces that are not part of a set but provide an experience boost or other skill-boosting effect.

Skill Item Effect(s) Source(s)
Agility Agility cape
  • Once per day, restores 100% run energy and provides the effect of a stamina potion for one minute
  • Acts as a graceful cape
 Achieving 99 Agility and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Cooking Cooking gauntlets
  • Reduces burn rate[n 1]
 Reward from Family Crest/Family Pest
Cooking cape
  • Food will never be burned while cooking
  • Acts as a chef's hat for entering the Cooks' Guild
 Achieving 99 Cooking and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Farming Magic secateurs
  • Increases the crop yield of herbs, allotments, celastrus trees, grape vines, and hops by 10%, as well as yielding more herbs from Herbiboars.
 Partial completion of Fairytale I - Growing Pains
Farming cape
  • Herb patches have a 5% increase in yield[n 2]
  • Unlimited teleports to the Farming Guild
 Achieving 99 Farming and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Fishing Fish sack barrel
  • Allows storing a combined total of 28 raw fish of any type except for harpoonfish, stackable fish such as karambwanji, and trophy fish.

Obtained by combining:

  • A Fish barrel, obtainable from Tempoross' reward pool at a rate of 1/400; and
  • A Fish sack, purchasable from Alry the Angler for 1000 Molch pearls
Herblore Amulet of chemistry
  • Has a 5% chance when mixing a potion to create 4 doses rather than the typical 3 doses, consuming one charge of five total. This does not grant extra experience.
  • Enchanting a jade amulet using the Lvl-2 Enchant spell
  • Purchasing from another player; or from the Grand Exchange for 1,412 coins
Herblore cape
  • Allows grimy herbs to be used in creating unfinished potions, giving the experience of cleaning the herb
  • Zahur in Nardah will create unfinished potions for 200 coins each
  • Can be searched for a pestle and mortar
 Achieving 99 Herblore and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Hunter Strung rabbit foot
  • Decreases the chance of receiving an empty nest while dismantling bird houses on Fossil Island[1]
  • Stringing a rabbit foot with a ball of wool, requiring 37 Crafting; or
  • Purchased from another player; or from the Grand Exchange for 637 coins
Mining Celestial ring
  • Gives an invisible +4 boost to Mining
  • When charged, gives a 1/10 chance of giving an extra ore when mining rocks up to adamantite, granting experience for both ores mined
 Purchased from Dusuri's Star Shop for 2000 stardust
Celestial signet

Same as Celestial ring; in addition:

  • Grants a 10% chance to not use a charge when using crystal equipment, excluding the Blade of Saeldor and the Bow of Faerdhinen
 Obtained by combining:
  • A Celestial ring, purchasable from Dusuri for 2000 stardust; and
  • An Elven signet, obtainable by hunting crystal implings and opening the jars; together with
  • 1000 stardust and 100 crystal shards, requiring 70 Smithing and 70 Crafting (boostable)

 Mining gloves
  • Gives a chance to prevent rocks from becoming depleted after mining an ore from them[n 3]
 Purchased with unidentified minerals from Mining Guild Mineral Exchange

Varrock armour
  • Gives a 10% chance to mine an extra ore in standard rocks[n 4]
  • Varrock armour 4 acts as a prospector jacket
 Completing tiers of the Varrock Diary
Mining cape
  • Gives a 5% chance of receiving an extra ore while mining ore up to adamantite[n 5]
 Achieving 99 Mining and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Runecraft Runecraft cape
  • Allows access to any runic altar without a talisman or tiara
  • Prevents essence pouches from degrading when filling them
 Achieving 99 Runecraft and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Slayer

Slayer equipment See the main page on Slayer equipment for information on the various tools and weapons used when fighting Slayer monsters. Various sources
Smithing Goldsmith gauntlets
  • 2.5x experience when smelting gold ore into bars
 Reward from Family Crest/Pest

Varrock armour
  • Gives a 10% chance to smelt two bars at once when using the Edgeville furnace[n 6]
 Completing tiers of the Varrock Diary
Smithing cape
  • Makes the coal bag capable of holding 36 coal instead of 27
  • Acts as a pair of goldsmith gauntlets
 Achieving 99 Smithing and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Thieving Dodgy necklace
  • Additional 10% chance of being successful when pickpocketing[n 7]
  • Enchanting an opal necklace using the Lvl-1 Enchant spell
  • Purchasing from another player; or from the Grand Exchange for 1,688 coins
Gloves of silence
  • Reduces pickpocketing failure rate by 5%[n 8]
  • Created by Asyff at the Fancy Clothes Store in Varrock for a cost of 2 dark kebbit furs and 600 coins
  • Purchased from another player; or from the Grand Exchange for 4,114 coins
Thieving cape
  • Additional 10% chance of being successful when pickpocketing[n 7]
 Achieving 99 Thieving and purchasing for 99,000 coins
Woodcutting Strung rabbit foot
  • Increases the drop rate of egg nests from 3/100 to 3/95. This is done by removing 5 seed nest rolls; the seed nest rate therefore decreases from 65/100 to 60/95.[2] As such, players who value seed nests should not wear this necklace while woodcutting.
  • Stringing a rabbit foot with a ball of wool, requiring 37 Crafting; or
  • Purchased from another player; or from the Grand Exchange for 637 coins
Woodcutting cape
  • Additional 10% chance of a bird nest falling while chopping trees
 Achieving 99 Woodcutting and purchasing for 99,000 coins
  1. ↑ Effect applies only to the following five fish: lobsters, swordfish, monkfish, sharks, and anglerfish
  2. ↑ Stacks with the magic secateurs
  3. ↑ Standard mining gloves affect silver, coal, and gold. Superior mining gloves affect mithril, adamantite, and runite. Expert mining gloves combine the effects of standard and superior gloves, while also affecting amethyst crystals.
  4. ↑ Varrock armour 1 affects rocks up to gold, as well as tephra. Varrock armour 2 affects rocks up to mithril, as well as lovakite, sandstone, and granite. Varrock armour 3 affects rocks up to adamantite, as well as soft clay. Varrock armour 4 affects all standard rocks, including amethyst crystals.
  5. ↑ Stacks with Varrock armour
  6. ↑ Varrock armour 1 affects bars up to steel. Varrock armour 2 affects bars up to mithril. Varrock armour 3 affects bars up to adamantite. Varrock armour 4 affects all bars.
  7. ↑ 7.0 7.1 Stacks with the completion of the Easy, Medium, and Hard Ardougne Diaries
  8. ↑ Does not stack with the completion of the Medium and Hard Ardougne Diaries. Completion of the medium diary causes the gloves to become ineffective and to not degrade within Ardougne; likewise, completion of the hard diary does the same in all of Gielenor, and makes the gloves completely obsolete.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. "Collection Log Improvements and The Last of Poll 74." 7 April 2021. Old School RuneScape News.
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 26 October 2018. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "If you've got the rabbit foot necklace, pick number 0-94 inclusive. Otherwise, pick number 0-99 inclusive. 0 = red egg, 1 = blue egg, 2 = green egg, 3-34 = ring, otherwise it's seeds."
